alert.note: Alert for Grayson; Smyth; Tazewell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 17 at 2:19PM EST until January 17 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to an inch. Winds gusting as high as 50 to 60 mph. The strongest gusts will occur along the higher ridges, particularly northwest North Carolina into bordering extreme southwest Virginia. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Virginia, northwest North Carolina and southeast West Virginia. * WHEN...Until 10 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact local travel. Strong winds could cause tree damage. The cold wind chills as low as 5 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities...and use caution while driving. Please report snow, sleet or ice accumulations via email at rnk.skywarn@noaa.gov or by calling the National Weather Service toll free at...1...866...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Leave a message with your observation and the specific location where it occurred. You can also post your report to National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
